subject: Re: A JUnit extension for regression test prioritization
msgSnippet: Mr. Sparks, I tried downloading the tools you suggested, but none of them seem to come with the JUnit test suites included.  Is it possible for me to download
messageBody:
Mr. Sparks,

I tried downloading the tools you suggested, but none of them seem to
come with the JUnit test suites included. Is it possible for me to
download the unit tests themselves?

thank you,

Matt



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Malcolm Sparks <malcolm@c...> wrote:
> Checkstyle, cruisecontrol and JUnit itself all have unit test suites.
>
> Have a look at http://jcoverage.com/samples/ for coverage results
> on these test suites.
>
> On Thu, 2003-09-18 at 03:09, mjrummel2000 wrote:
> > Hello JUniters,
> >
> > I am a college student currently writing a senior project on
> > regression test prioritization. Regression test prioritization is a
> > method of organizing test cases such that those tests deemed to be
> > more effective by a test adequacy criterion are placed at the
> > beginning of a regression test suite. The tool that I plan to build
> > will be implemented as an extension to JUnit. As part of my
> > analysis, I shall run my prioritization tool on a set of test cases
> > for a real world Java application to see if the rate of fault
> > detection increases. If anyone has a Java application with a
> > substantial set of JUnit test cases or would like to suggest a site
> > with an application and test cases that I can download, I would
> > appreciate the contribution.
> >
> > Thank you for your consideration in this matter.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
> > junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
> >
> >
> > Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to
http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
> --
> Malcolm Sparks
> Congreve Computing
> http://www.congreve.com
